original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: THE NEWBORN. Age group: 0 – 28 DAYS. Subsection: IMMEDIATE CARE OF THE NEWBORN (Code: 1.1). Case: Normal Newborn. History includes: Mother’s antenatal history. Birth conditions. Immediate post-delivery status. Examination may involve: Check breathing and skin color. Measure temperature and weight. Check for congenital abnormalities.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: THE NEWBORN. Age group: 0 – 28 DAYS. Subsection: IMMEDIATE CARE OF THE NEWBORN (Code: 1.1). Case: Meconium-stained liquor and no cry. History includes: Presence of meconium. Crying status after birth. Examination may involve: Check for asphyxia. Breathing effort.

subsection_title: NEWBORN WITHOUT ANY COMPLAINT – THE WELL CHILD
examination: Inspect for jaundice, rashes, or abnormalities
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: THE NEWBORN. Age group: 0 – 28 DAYS. Subsection: NEWBORN WITHOUT ANY COMPLAINT – THE WELL CHILD (Code: 1.2). Case: Routine newborn follow-up. History includes: Feeding, sleeping, urination, immunization status. Examination may involve: Growth monitoring. Inspect for jaundice, rashes, or abnormalities.

action: Start supportive care (keep warm, feed expressed milk)
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: THE NEWBORN. Age group: 0 – 28 DAYS. Subsection: NEWBORN EMERGENCIES (Code: 1.3). Case: Danger signs in newborn. History includes: Poor feeding. Lethargy. Fever or hypothermia. Examination may involve: Check temperature, respiration, activity level. Inspect for jaundice or infection.

examination: Inspect for cleft lip, clubfoot, or spinal defects
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: THE NEWBORN. Age group: 0 – 28 DAYS. Subsection: NEWBORN ABNORMALITIES (Code: 1.4). Case: Congenital anomalies. History includes: Family history of abnormalities. Antenatal complications. Examination may involve: Inspect for cleft lip, clubfoot, or spinal defects.

examination: Inspect for thrush or cleft palate
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: THE NEWBORN. Age group: 0 – 28 DAYS. Subsection: ORAL HEALTH (Code: 1.5). Case: Mouth inspection in newborn. History includes: Feeding difficulties. Mouth ulcers. Examination may involve: Inspect for thrush or cleft palate.

clinical_judgement: Routine evaluation or early warning signs
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: EARLY CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: CHILD’S FIRST VISIT (Code: 2.1). Case: Initial visit of infant/toddler. History includes: Birth history. Immunization history. Feeding pattern. Examination may involve: Weigh and measure child. Check for developmental milestones.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: EARLY CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: HEALTHY CHILD (Code: 2.2). Case: Well child follow-up. History includes: Diet, sleep, play. Bowel/bladder habits. Vaccination status. Examination may involve: Growth monitoring. Developmental check.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: EARLY CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: FEVER (Code: 2.3). Case: Child with elevated temperature. History includes: Duration. Associated symptoms. Contact history. Examination may involve: Check temperature. Look for source of infection.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: EARLY CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: CONVULSION (Code: 2.4). Case: Seizure in child. History includes: Fever, past episodes. Trauma or birth history. Examination may involve: Neurological exam. Check for neck stiffness.

action: Refer if severe or with danger signs
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: EARLY CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: COUGH/DIFFICULT BREATHING (Code: 2.5). Case: Child with respiratory symptoms. History includes: Onset and duration. Noisy breathing. Feeding difficulties. Examination may involve: Count respiratory rate. Observe for chest in-drawing.

action: Refer if persistent or bloody stools
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: EARLY CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: DIARRHOEA (Code: 2.6). Case: Child with loose stools. History includes: Duration. Blood in stool. Feeding and fluid intake. Examination may involve: Signs of dehydration. General condition.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: EARLY CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: VOMITING (Code: 2.7). Case: Frequent vomiting. History includes: Relation to feeds. Appearance of vomit. Other symptoms. Examination may involve: Check hydration. Palpate abdomen.

action: Refer for lab confirmation if severe
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: EARLY CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: PALLOR (Code: 2.8). Case: Suspected anemia. History includes: Fatigue. Pica. Dietary intake. Examination may involve: Inspect palms, conjunctiva. Check spleen size.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: EARLY CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: JAUNDICE (Code: 2.9). Case: Yellowish eyes or palms. History includes: Duration. Urine/stool color. Contact with hepatitis. Examination may involve: Inspect sclera, palms. Palpate liver.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: EARLY CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: MALNUTRITION (Code: 2.10). Case: Underweight or wasted child. History includes: Feeding history. Frequency of illness. Examination may involve: Check weight-for-height. Mid-upper arm circumference.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: EARLY CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: HIV/AIDS (Code: 2.11). Case: HIV-exposed or symptomatic child. History includes: Maternal HIV status. Weight loss, recurrent infections. Examination may involve: Check lymph nodes. Oral exam for thrush.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: MIDDLE CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: CHILD FIRST VISIT (Code: 3.1). Case: Routine health check-up. History includes: Immunization history. Nutrition. School performance. Examination may involve: Height and weight measurement. Vision and hearing check.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: MIDDLE CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: FEVER (Code: 3.2). Case: Febrile child. History includes: Onset and pattern. Recent illness in family. Travel history. Examination may involve: Temperature. Check ears, throat, chest.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: MIDDLE CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: CONVULSION (Code: 3.3). Case: Seizure episode. History includes: Prior seizures. Fever or trauma. Duration and type. Examination may involve: Neurological assessment. Check for signs of meningitis.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: MIDDLE CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: COUGH (Code: 3.4). Case: Persistent cough. History includes: Duration. Associated fever or chest pain. Examination may involve: Check respiratory rate. Auscultate lungs.

action: Refer if signs of severe dehydration

Presence of blood. Hydration status. Examination may involve: Check for dehydration. General physical status.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: MIDDLE CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: VOMITING (Code: 3.6). Case: Repeated vomiting. History includes: Timing, content of vomit. Associated symptoms. Examination may involve: Check hydration. Palpate abdomen.

clinical_judgement: Migraine, tension headache, or secondary cause
action: Refer if persistent or neurologic signs present
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: MIDDLE CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: HEADACHE (Code: 3.7). Case: Complaint of headache. History includes: Duration, severity. Associated visual changes or fever. Examination may involve: Check temperature, BP, eye exam.

action: Refer if severe or no improvement
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: MIDDLE CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: PALLOR (Code: 3.8). Case: Suspected anemia. History includes: Fatigue. Dietary history. Previous infections. Examination may involve: Check palms and conjunctiva. Palpate spleen.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: MIDDLE CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: YELLOWISH EYES (JAUNDICE) (Code: 3.9). Case: Jaundice in child. History includes: Urine/stool color. Duration. Contact with hepatitis cases. Examination may involve: Inspect sclera, palms. Palpate liver.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: MIDDLE CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: NUTRITIONAL DISORDERS (Code: 3.10). Case: Undernutrition or obesity. History includes: Diet history. Activity level. Feeding practices. Examination may involve: Check weight, height, MUAC.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADOLESCENT HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: PUBERTY CONCERNS (FEMALE) (Code: 4.1). Case: Female adolescent with pubertal concerns. History includes: Menstrual onset. Cycle regularity. Breast development. Examination may involve: Secondary sexual characteristics. General health exam.

action: Refer if delayed or abnormal findings
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADOLESCENT HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: PUBERTY CONCERNS (MALE) (Code: 4.2). Case: Male adolescent with development concerns. History includes: Voice changes. Genital development. Growth pattern. Examination may involve: Inspect for gynecomastia. Check testicular size.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADOLESCENT HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: CONTRACEPTIVE CHOICE FOR ADOLESCENTS (Code: 4.3). Case: Request for contraception. History includes: Sexual activity. Desire for spacing. Medical history. Examination may involve: BP. Rule out pregnancy or STI.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADOLESCENT HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: SEXUAL DYSFUNCTION (Code: 4.4). Case: Adolescent reports sexual concerns. History includes: Erectile problems. Pain during intercourse. Psychosocial history. Examination may involve: Inspect genitals. Assess psychological well-being.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADOLESCENT HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: GENITO-URINARY TRACT DISORDERS (Code: 4.5). Case: Urinary/genital issues. History includes: Dysuria. Discharge. Frequency. Examination may involve: Inspect genital area. Palpate lower abdomen.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADOLESCENT HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: ABORTION (Code: 4.6). Case: Suspected abortion. History includes: Bleeding, abdominal pain. Menstrual and sexual history. Examination may involve: Check bleeding severity. Vital signs.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADOLESCENT HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: NUTRITIONAL DISORDERS (Code: 4.7). Case: Weight or dietary concerns. History includes: Eating patterns. Body image. Menstrual history. Examination may involve: Height, weight, BMI.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADOLESCENT HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: MENTAL HEALTH DISORDERS (Code: 4.8). Case: Mood or behavior changes. History includes: Depression, anxiety, school issues. Examination may involve: Mental status exam.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADOLESCENT HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: VIOLENCE AND ASSAULTIVE BEHAVIOUR (Code: 4.9). Case: Report or signs of abuse. History includes: Nature of incident. Perpetrator identity. Examination may involve: Physical and mental exam.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADOLESCENT HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: SEXUALLY TRANSMITTED INFECTIONS (STIs) (Code: 4.10). Case: Symptoms of STI. History includes: Discharge, itching, pain. Examination may involve: Inspect genitalia.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADOLESCENT HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: INJURIES, FRACTURES AND BITES (Code: 4.11). Case: Physical trauma. History includes: Cause, location, time. Examination may involve: Check injury site. Assess for bleeding or swelling.

action: Refer if signs of systemic illness
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADOLESCENT HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: NECK DISORDERS/INJURIES (Code: 4.12). Case: Neck pain/swelling. History includes: Injury or infection. Onset and duration. Examination may involve: Inspect and palpate neck.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADOLESCENT HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: EAR, NOSE AND THROAT DISORDERS (Code: 4.13). Case: ENT complaints. History includes: Ear pain. Sore throat. Nasal congestion. Examination may involve: Inspect ears, nose, throat.

clinical_judgement: General wellness or early identification of disease
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: ADULT FIRST VISIT (Code: 5.1). Case: Routine adult evaluation. History includes: Chief complaint. Medical and surgical history. Lifestyle (smoking, alcohol, diet). Examination may involve: Vital signs (BP, pulse, temp). General physical exam.

examination: Look for localizing signs (e.g. throat, chest, abdomen)
action: Refer if not resolving in 3 days
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: FEVER (Code: 5.2). Case: Fever without clear source. History includes: Onset, pattern. Associated symptoms. Travel or contact history. Examination may involve: Temperature. Look for localizing signs (e.g. throat, chest, abdomen).

action: Refer for sputum test or chest X-ray
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: COUGH (Code: 5.3). Case: Persistent cough. History includes: Duration. Sputum, chest pain, wheeze. Examination may involve: Auscultate lungs. Check lymph nodes.

history: History of asthma or cardiac disease
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: DIFFICULTY IN BREATHING (Code: 5.4). Case: Shortness of breath. History includes: Onset, triggers, orthopnea. History of asthma or cardiac disease. Examination may involve: Respiratory rate. Oxygen saturation (if available). Auscultate chest.

action: Refer if severe or bloody stools
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: DIARRHOEA (Code: 5.5). Case: Frequent loose stools in adult. History includes: Duration. Blood in stool. Dehydration symptoms. Examination may involve: Check hydration status. Abdominal exam.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: VOMITING (Code: 5.6). Case: Adult with repeated vomiting. History includes: Timing, relation to meals. Presence of blood or bile. Examination may involve: Check hydration and abdomen.

clinical_judgement: Likely strain, infection, or systemic cause
action: Refer if not resolving or chronic
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: BODY PAIN (Code: 5.7). Case: Generalized or localized body aches. History includes: Duration. Site-specific issues. Work or activity patterns. Examination may involve: Musculoskeletal assessment.

clinical_judgement: Possible angina, reflux or musculoskeletal pain
original_text_chunk: Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: CHEST PAIN (Code: 5.8). Case: Adult with chest discomfort. History includes: Onset, severity, radiation. Relation to exertion or meals. Examination may involve: Vital signs. Auscultate heart and lungs.

clinical_judgement: Tension headache, migraine, or systemic cause
action: Refer if severe, chronic, or neurologic signs

Associated symptoms (fever, vision loss). Examination may involve: BP. Neurological signs. Visual exam.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: PALLOR (Code: 5.10). Case: Suspected anemia. History includes: Fatigue. Dizziness. Menstrual history (if female). Examination may involve: Check conjunctiva, nails, tongue. Palpate spleen.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: WEIGHT LOSS (Code: 5.11). Case: Unexplained weight loss. History includes: Appetite changes. Chronic illness. HIV status. Examination may involve: Check BMI. General physical exam.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: JAUNDICE (Code: 5.12). Case: Yellowing of eyes or skin. History includes: Dark urine. Abdominal pain. Drug or alcohol history. Examination may involve: Inspect sclera and palms. Palpate liver.

clinical_judgement: Allergic, fungal or bacterial skin disease

case: Swelling in lower limbs or face
history: Onset, associated breathlessness or urine changes
clinical_judgement: Possible cardiac, renal or hepatic cause

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: BURNS (Code: 5.15). Case: Thermal or chemical burn. History includes: Cause and duration. Extent of affected area. Examination may involve: Assess depth and surface area.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: WOUNDS, SORES, ULCERS, FRACTURES & BITES (Code: 5.16). Case: Injuries or chronic ulcers. History includes: Cause, duration, signs of infection. Examination may involve: Inspect and palpate area.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: HEAD INJURIES (Code: 5.17). Case: Trauma to the head. History includes: Loss of consciousness. Vomiting, confusion. Examination may involve: Neurological assessment. Pupil check.

case: Pain, stiffness, or swelling in neck
history: Recent injury, fever, or sore throat
action: Refer if abscess or systemic signs

case: Eye pain, discharge or vision changes

history: Sore throat, ear pain, nasal blockage

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: ORAL HEALTH DISORDERS (Code: 5.21). Case: Toothache, bleeding gums, oral sores. History includes: Onset, eating habits, hygiene. Examination may involve: Inspect oral cavity.

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: ABDOMINAL DISORDERS (Code: 5.24). Case: Pain, swelling or indigestion. History includes: Onset, location, triggers. Examination may involve: Palpate abdomen.

history: Abdominal pain, weight loss, anal itching

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: ADULT HEALTH CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: GENITO-URINARY DISORDERS (Code: 5.26). Case: UTI, discharge, frequency. History includes: Painful urination, urgency. Sexual activity. Examination may involve: Check for lower abdominal tenderness.

case: Male with urethral discharge or pain

history: Symptoms like bleeding, swelling, or headache
action: Counsel on danger signs and birth plan

action: Refer for complications or prolonged labor

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: MATERNAL HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: POSTNATAL DISORDERS (Code: 6.3). Case: Woman after delivery. History includes: Bleeding, fever, pain. Breastfeeding status. Examination may involve: Check lochia, uterine involution. Inspect perineum and breasts.

action: Counsel on side effects and follow-up

Document: CHO Guidelines. Section: MATERNAL HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: PRE-MENOPAUSE (Code: 6.6). Case: Perimenopausal complaints. History includes: Irregular menses. Hot flashes. Mood changes. Examination may involve: General and pelvic exam.

clinical_judgement: Prostate enlargement, UTI, or age-related incontinence

examination: Check that the baby is pink
notes: Do not bathe for first 24 hours
original_text_chunk: Document: CHEW Guidelines. Section: THE NEWBORN. Age group: 0 – 28 DAYS. Subsection: IMMEDIATE CARE OF THE NEWBORN (Code: 1.1). Case: Normal Newborn. History includes: No specific history listed.. Examination may involve: Check that the baby is pink. Count respiratory rate (40 - 60 bpm). Measure temperature (36.5 – 37.5°C). Weigh the baby.

notes: Do not slap, pinch or turn baby upside down
Continue newborn care if breathing resumes
original_text_chunk: Document: CHEW Guidelines. Section: THE NEWBORN. Age group: 0 – 28 DAYS. Subsection: IMMEDIATE CARE OF THE NEWBORN (Code: 1.1). Case: Meconium-stained liquor and not breathing. subsection_title: NEWBORN WITHOUT ANY COMPLAINT – THE WELL CHILD
history: Ask about feeding pattern and sleeping
original_text_chunk: Document: CHEW Guidelines. Section: THE NEWBORN. Age group: 0 – 28 DAYS. Subsection: NEWBORN WITHOUT ANY COMPLAINT – THE WELL CHILD (Code: 1.2). Case: Routine Evaluation. History includes: Ask about feeding pattern and sleeping. Ask about urination and defecation. Examination may involve: Check for normal weight gain. Measure temperature. Inspect for jaundice, birthmarks, abnormalities.

Document: CHEW Guidelines. Section: THE NEWBORN. Age group: 0 – 28 DAYS. Subsection: NEWBORN EMERGENCIES (Code: 1.3). Case: Danger Signs. History includes: Poor feeding. Convulsions. Fast breathing. Fever. Hypothermia. Examination may involve: Count respiratory rate. Check for chest in-drawing. Assess jaundice.

history: Any family history of birth defects
examination: Check for cleft lip/palate, limb deformities
action: Refer for surgical or specialist intervention
original_text_chunk: Document: CHEW Guidelines. Section: THE NEWBORN. Age group: 0 – 28 DAYS. Subsection: NEWBORN ABNORMALITIES (Code: 1.4). Case: Congenital Conditions. history: Ask about recent illnesses or hospital visits
action: Encourage continued breastfeeding or proper diet

Inquire about sleep patterns. Check immunization history. Ask about recent illnesses or hospital visits. Examination may involve: General physical exam. Review growth chart. Check milestone achievement.

examination: Check for rash, sore throat, ear discharge
action: Treat presumptive malaria if endemic area
Refer if fever persists > 3 days or danger signs present

Recent exposures. Associated symptoms. Examination may involve: Measure temperature. Check for rash, sore throat, ear discharge.

Document: CHEW Guidelines. Section: CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: DIARRHOEA (Code: 2.6). Case: Child with frequent loose stools. History includes: Duration. Presence of blood. Feeding and hydration. Examination may involve: Assess dehydration. Check general condition.

Document: CHEW Guidelines. Section: CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: VOMITING (Code: 2.7). Case: Recurrent vomiting. History includes: Frequency. Relation to feeding. Bilious or blood-stained. Examination may involve: Check hydration. Abdominal tenderness.

Document: CHEW Guidelines. Section: CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: PALLOR (Code: 2.8). Case: Suspected anemia. History includes: Fatigue. Diet. History of malaria. Examination may involve: Check conjunctiva and palms.

Document: CHEW Guidelines. Section: CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: JAUNDICE (Code: 2.9). Case: Yellow eyes or skin. History includes: Onset. Associated fever or urine color. Examination may involve: Check palms, sclera, abdomen.

Document: CHEW Guidelines. Section: CHILDHOOD CONDITIONS. Age group: . Subsection: MALNUTRITION (Code: 2.10). Case: Underweight child. History includes: Diet. Feeding frequency. Illness. Examination may involve: Check weight-for-age. Look for edema.

history: Ask about birth and immunization history

examination: Assess for rash, throat inflammation, ear signs

action: Treat with antibiotics if pneumonia suspected
Refer if wheezing or chronic symptoms

history: Associated fever, vision issues, or stress
clinical_judgement: Likely tension headache or febrile illness

action: Provide education on puberty and hygiene
Refer if abnormal bleeding or delayed puberty

action: Refer if signs of delayed or abnormal development

action: Educate on safe sex and STI prevention

case: Concerns about sexual performance or function
action: Refer to adolescent or psychological services if persistent

action: Refer for lab testing if unclear

Document: CHEW Guidelines. Section: ADOLESCENT HEALTH. Age group: . Subsection: ABORTION (Code: 4.6). Case: Suspected incomplete or unsafe abortion. History includes: Bleeding. Abdominal pain. Last menstrual period. Examination may involve: Check for bleeding, fever, shock.

action: Refer for forensic and psychological care

action: Refer if signs of infection or neurological signs

clinical_judgement: Likely upper respiratory infection or otitis media

examination: Check BMI and conduct general exam

examination: Signs of infection (e.g. throat, chest, abdomen)
action: Refer if fever persists >3 days or severe symptoms

action: Refer for sputum test or X-ray

clinical_judgement: Possible asthma, COPD or heart failure

action: Refer if blood in stool or severe dehydration

action: Refer if persistent or associated with fever

action: Refer for persistent or severe cases

action: Cool burn, dress, refer if extensive

examination: Abdominal examination for fetal growth and lie
Test urine for protein and sugar

Schedule next visit or refer if high-risk

action: Educate on use and side effects

examination: Check for signs of hormonal imbalance
